newsitem.title: ROMANIA: Foreign broker increases stake in Romania Azomures.
newsitem.headline: Foreign broker increases stake in Romania Azomures.

text.p: A Turkish-based securities company has acquired a total 6.16 percent in Romania's listed fertiliser maker Azomures after a special trade on the Bucharest bourse last month, Romanian market regulator CNVM said.
"After the special deal, Global Menkul Degerler's stake of Azomures rose to 6.16 percent," CNVM press officer Adela Ionescu told Reuters on Tuesday.

The special trade -- a large deal struck outside the market and reported to the stock exchange later -- involved 9.525 million shares worth around 20.29 billion lei and was struck on April 24. It represented 4.6 percent of Azomures' shares.
Global Menkul Degerler, based in Istanbul, had previously bought 1.56 percent in Azomures, a bourse official said.

Azomures, a first-tier stock traded actively ever since it joined the exchange last January, has a share capital of 209.5 billion lei in shares with a nominal value of 1,000 lei each. A Romanian trading company has 51 percent.
According to stock market rules, investors who get more than five percent in a Romanian company become "significant shareholders" and should be made known.
At the latest trading session on Monday, Azomures closed 400 lei stronger at 3,400. ($=7,094 lei)
